name: Movie Titles  Month by Month - Almost! Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who is the leading female star of "June Bride" in which the events at a wedding in a small town are covered by two reporters who are constantly in dispute with each other?
questions.explanation:
Bette Davis.

	Robert Montgomery is the journalist who finds himself working against his will for a top woman's magazine. Bette Davis is his new boss but also his old lover. The assignment in Indiana inevitably helps to put their renewed relationship into perspective.

questions.text: A serial killer has turned New York into a city of fear with eleven murders in eleven months. What is the name of this movie starring Kevin Kline?
questions.explanation:
The January Man.

	The movie also starred Susan Sarandon, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Danny Aiello, Rod Steiger, Harvey Keitel and Alan Rickman. Pat O'Connor, the director, tries hard to sustain that difficult blend of violence and comedy that can easily go too far in one direction.

questions.text: Which of the following April movies starred Jack Lemmon and Catherine Deneuve?
questions.explanation:
The April Fools.

	The other stars of this 1969 movie included Myrna Loy, Charles Boyer and Peter Lawford. An elopement to Paris is at the centre of this romantic comedy.

questions.text: What is the name of the Jeannette MacDonald and Nelson Eddy movie in which the two lovers are reunited as ghosts?
questions.explanation:
Maytime.

	The plot is basically about a love triangle in which a star of the opera falls in love with a singer with no money. Tragedy comes when the jealous impresario husband, Nazaroff,  resorts to shooting the Nelson Eddy character.

questions.text: To which political convention was combat veteran, Ron Kovic, scheduled to make his climactic anti-war speech, in the movie "Born on the Fourth of July"?
questions.explanation:
The 1976 Democratic Convention.

	Tom Cruise stars as the man who was paralyzed from the chest down by a gunshot wound he received in Vietnam. The horror and futility of war is brought home by the scenes in the veterans' hospital, and by Kovic's anguish as he undergoes his political awakening.

questions.text: Harrison Ford made the character of Tom Clancy's hero Jack Ryan his own in "Patriot Games" but who had played the same role in "The Hunt for Red October"?
questions.explanation:
Alec Baldwin.

	Sean Connery in fact played the part of the Russian nuclear submarine commander who declared that he wanted to defect to the West. John McTiernan, who also made "Predator" and "Die Hard", had another success on his hands with this movie.

questions.text: Which of the following descriptions best fits the plot of the movie "September Storm"?
questions.correct: One girl and two men search for treasure off a Mediterranean island.
options: An Englishman on holiday in Spain gets involved in murder.
In old Venice a noblewoman falls in love with an army officer.
Escaped convicts take over a town in California.
questions.explanation:
One girl and two men search for treasure off a Mediterranean island.

	This movie was based on the book "The Girl in the Red Bikini" and starred Joanne Dru, Mark Stevens and Robert Strauss.

questions.text: Which movie about a girl who takes a new lover every month was first released in 1968 and was released again 2001 with Keanu Reeves in the leading male role?
questions.explanation:
Sweet November.

	The original film starred Anthony Newley and Sandy Dennis. The girl's terminal illness is always an issue that is going to cause difficulties for the film directors. The second time around she was played by Charlize Theron.

questions.text: What is the name of the movie about the clever interpreter who manages to get the American troops to appreciate certain aspects of the Oriental way of life?
questions.correct: The Teahouse of the August Moon
questions.explanation:
The Teahouse of the August Moon.

	This movie was based on a Pulitzer Prize-winning Broadway comedy written by John Patrick and starred Marlon Brando, Glenn Ford and Eddie Albert. John Patrick eased the transition from stage to screen by writing the screenplay.

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct plot for "Maytime in Mayfair", a British movie of the late 1940s?
questions.correct: A playboy falls in love with the manager of a dress salon he inherits.
options: A jilted girl finds new love amongst the aristocracy.
A ruthless property developer buys up war-damaged slums.
A top British tennis player loses her heart to a Polish count.
questions.explanation:
A playboy falls in love with the manager of a dress salon he inherits.

	This comedy starred Anna Neagle and Michael Wilding and was an attempt to cash in on the success of its predecessor called "Spring in Park Lane". Sorry there were no real entries for February, December or March. I did contemplate "March or Die" but that would be cheating!
